issue.title: In the API to select tests, apply the requested patch

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Depends on #1299 and #1300.

This is quite similar to what we're doing in the code-review bot, with the difference that we're not getting patches from Phabricator but from hgmo.

In the worker, we should retrieve the patch from the specified repository and at the specified revisions (with its non public parents) and apply it to the locally cloned mozilla-central repository.

Blocks #632.

issue.title: Support classifying commits for test selection

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
- [x] Add a setup step to the http service to setup the environment for classifying commits - #1299
- [x] Add the scaffolding needed to add an API call to select tests - #1300
- [x] In the API to select tests, apply the requested patch - #1301 and #1372
- [x] Download test scheduling models in the HTTP service - #1330
- [x] In the API to select tests, apply the model to select tests - #1302 

------------------------------------------------------------

This is not going to be so easy.
1. We need to clone a mercurial repository on the service
2. We need to download the commits DB from the commit_retrieval task
3. We need to update the commits DB whenever there are new commits on mozilla-central
4. The client will send a patch, we will apply the commit, analyze it to get its features, revert it

Similar to https://github.com/mozilla/relman-auto-nag/blob/b7bda7f4c29e59d36684b39fec522a79bacefcbb/auto_nag/scripts/regressor.py#L1, but this one is easier as it's only analyzing new real commits, we will instead analyze proposed patches too (which might or might not be landed at some point).

body: @La0 would it help if I took a look at this issue while you worked on #1299 ? Or do you think you would have this finished in a couple days anyway?

I'm on PTO tommorow, will start looking into these issues on Wednesday.
I *should* have something by the end of the week, if that's too slow, feel free to re-assign the issues.

Ok I don't have permission to re-assign, but I'm going to take a look at getting a head start here. If I'm not done by the time you're ready to work on it.. I can upload what I have and you can take over again if you like.
